CatDescriptText: Sidney Gelb, college student, 3700 Orpwood Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 10, 1959, pg. 6 with question: "With Mayor Lawrence performing his duties as Governor in Harrisburg, do you believe the Democratic party in Pittsburgh will be weakened by his absence?" answer reads: "Yes, I do.  And the reason is that when you ask the question, 'Where is the party whip to take Lawrence's place here?" you can't think of a man who can replace the Mayor.  The replacement is so hard because Mayor Lawrence is such a dynamic man, and accomplishes so much."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Sidney Gelb wearing eyeglasses, zippered jacket with striped collar and cuffs, and holding rumpled paper bag, standing on sidewalk, Downtown
